image.altText: A pink substance in the beach tide.

props.synopsis: Scientists say a bioluminescent algae causes the red tides at the centre of recent environmentalist concerns — but that's not to say the magnificent display is totally harmless to marine life.

title.children: Tasmania's bioluminescence unrelated to salmon farm nutrients, scientist says

image.altText: A street with housing

props.synopsis: Three shootings have occurred in northern Hobart in the space of a week, with police saying two appear to be related.

title.children: Two people arrested following spate of Hobart shootings

image.altText: Tasmania Police vehicles.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old girl from interstate and a 38-year-old Rosebery man, who were both on an all-terrain vehicle, died at the scene on the Murchison Highway after a collision with a ute.

title.children: 15yo girl, man die after their ATV collides with ute on highway

image.altText: Forty-spotted pardalote holding a white feather in its beak.

props.synopsis: Donning a helmet and a well-equipped harness, Dr Fernanda Alves looks like she is set to take on an extreme sport. Instead, she is climbing trees to check nesting boxes for a tiny and very rare bird.

title.children: 'So, I had this idea': Scientists dispense insecticide-coated feathers for birds to build nests

image.altText: Woman sits by a plant bed, posing for photo

props.synopsis: Helen Burnet fronted the cameras on Friday to announce she was quitting the party she's been a member of for more than 20 years, but it's still not clear exactly why she's made the move.

title.children: Helen Burnet held a 20-minute press conference but one answer is still unclear

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of a moustachioed man in blue prison garb standing in court.

props.synopsis: Nicolás Maduro and Cilia Flores, who were captured in Caracas at the weekend, face multiple charges.

title.children: 'I am innocent': Deposed Venezuelan leader Maduro, wife enter pleas in NYC

image.altText: A man grasps a wooden podium wit both hands as he looks at a room filled with people.

props.synopsis: The warning by the UN chief comes during an emergency session of the United Nations Security Council, just blocks from where Nicolás Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores are facing a Manhattan judge.

title.children: UN chief warns US operation in Venezuela sets dangerous precedent

image.altText: Smoke floats to the sky of El Palito refinery in Venezuela.

props.synopsis: In a world awash with oil, US President Donald Trump's takeover of Venezuela seems to be more about power than production.

title.children: Trump's historic oil grab a brazen push for extraordinary power

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann takes his appeal to the High Court against the findings that he, on the balance of probabilities, raped Brittany Higgins in 2019.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann launches High Court appeal in latest defamation battle round

image.altText: The silhouette of a jogger at sunrise at Cronulla Beach

props.synopsis: The "most significant" heatwave south-eastern Australia has seen in six years is likely to trigger an extreme fire danger alongside searing hot temperatures.

title.children: Towns facing temperatures above 45C as extreme heatwave blasts Australia

image.altText: Birds eye view of a housing estate with an oval and park towards the bottom of the image

props.synopsis: Thousands of young trees dot the streets and front gardens of this outer Melbourne suburb as part of a neighbourhood-wide push to create more shade and curb the urban heat island effect.

title.children: Tree by tree, this new suburb is dodging baking heat in summer

image.altText: Brigitte Macron walking with black glasses.

props.synopsis: Several defendants told the court their comments were intended as humour or satire.

title.children: Paris court finds 10 people guilty of cyberbullying Brigitte Macron

image.altText: red flag on snow.

props.synopsis: The leaders of Denmark and Greenland have urged US President Donald Trump to stop threatening to take over Greenland.

title.children: Denmark tells Trump to stop Greenland 'threats'

image.altText: Travis Head holds two bats up towards the crowd as he walks off the field

props.synopsis: In what has been a bowlers' series, the class of Joe Root and Travis Head again shone on day two in Sydney, where it often took something silly for a wicket to fall.

title.children: Batting class prevails for Head and Root on a fiery day in Sydney

image.altText: Albanese gestures at a podium

props.synopsis: A group of former Labor MPs, senators and party officials have signed an open letter asking Anthony Albanese to call a national royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Labor figures urge Albanese to call Bondi federal royal commission

image.altText: A man in a black zipped jumper holds a water bottle and walks past a Manchester United logo on a black wall

props.synopsis: It comes less than a day after the club drew one-all with Leeds United and a testy post-match press conference in which Amorim questioned his own role and the club's management.

title.children: Manchester United sacks head coach Ruben Amorim

image.altText: The rural driveway of a prison with a sign reading "Langi Kal Kal"

props.synopsis: A farm worker says he was threatened by a man who escaped from Langi Kal Kal prison near Ballarat.

title.children: Prison escapee attacks Victorian farm worker

image.altText: A Singapore Airlines flight comes into land at Adelaide Airport.

props.synopsis: SA and NSW health authorities have issued alerts about a potential measles exposure risk, after a person with the disease recently caught a flight from Adelaide to Sydney.

title.children: Measles alert as Adelaide and Sydney airports among possible exposure sites

image.altText: A man sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: Australia's energy prices continue to soar as questions continue to be raised about the actions of providers, including by this pensioner who was overcharged and then had debt collectors chasing him.

title.children: How a 'ruthless' energy company went after a pensioner for money he didn't owe

image.altText: A man with a black towel draped over his head is questioned by media

props.synopsis: Muamer Nukic, a 50-year-old Queensland Police Service employee and described as a "self-proclaimed anti-Zionist" was granted bail in the Brisbane Magistrate Court on Monday.

title.children: Police employee faces court over alleged antisemitic online posts

image.altText: Naveed Akram

props.synopsis: The ABC understands Naveed Akram was moved earlier on Monday from Sydney's Long Bay jail hospital where he has been for the past fortnight.

title.children: Bondi Beach gunman moved to Goulburn Supermax prison

image.altText: Tonya Harding skates past Nancy Kerrigan.

props.synopsis: The genteel and sequined world of figure skating had its dark side exposed in a drama worthy of a soap opera in 1994, as Nancy Kerrigan was the victim of a dastardly plot to eliminate her from the Winter Olympics.

title.children: How a sour rivalry thrust figure skating into the realm of soap opera

image.altText: A map showing a large coloured circle labelled "12-U" along the far north Queensland coast.

props.synopsis: The chance of a tropical low off the Far North Queensland coast developing into a cyclone is increasing from low to moderate by the weekend, according to the weather bureau.

title.children: Bureau forecasts moderate chance of cyclone hitting Far North Queensland coast

image.altText: A generated image of people walking towards a stadium

props.synopsis: The new stadium will host the opening and closing ceremonies and athletics at the 2032 Games, before becoming the city’s main stadium with 63,000 seats.

title.children: Queensland government unveils plans for Olympic stadium

image.altText: Green island surrounded by sea.

props.synopsis: Boasting thousands of years of history and a World Heritage listing, Okinoshima is Japan's very own treasure island. It's also completely off limits to women.

title.children: The island in Japan 'whose name cannot be spoken'

image.altText: A crowd gathered around a pile of floral tributes laid at a memorial procession

props.synopsis: Swiss police say more than half of the 40 people killed after a fire broke out at a bar in the Crans-Montana resort were teenagers.

title.children: All victims of Swiss ski resort bar fire now identified

image.altText: Tennant Creek Police Station sign with tribute flowers on railing in foreground

props.synopsis: Police say the cause of a woman's death in a Northern Territory police watch house last month remains "undetermined" following a post-mortem examination conducted on Friday.

title.children: Cause of woman's death in custody still 'undetermined' after autopsy

image.altText: Australian currency

props.synopsis: Almost $300 million in refunds, dividends and cheques remain unclaimed by households and businesses across New South Wales, with locals urged to take action to secure the money they are owed.

title.children: 'We want to get that money back to you': $300m of unclaimed cash in NSW

image.altText: A photo of womens footballers with arms crossed in huddle.

props.synopsis: A country football league president has been reported to the AFL Integrity Unit over alleged comments about a club's "grooming and gender weirdness" after it was involved in blocking the club from entering a neighbouring competition.

title.children: League president reported to AFL over 'gender weirdness' alleged comments

image.altText: A woman with glasses looks at the camera in front of a huge monstera plant in a rattan vase

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

title.children: Katherine may have 700 half-siblings. She's trying to find them to pass on medical advice

image.altText: Novak Djokovic scratching his head with his racquet while on court.

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic is stepping away from the Professional Tennis Players Association citing concerns over transparency and governance within the organisation.

title.children: Djokovic quits players body he co-founded over transparency concerns

image.altText: A composite image of an Australian $1 coin and an ASX board

props.synopsis: The value of Australia's currency could move significantly up or down depending on the direction of interest rates. But the global economic backdrop will also be crucial in determining its direction.

title.children: The Australian dollar is at a critical crossroads. Which way will it go?

image.altText: Three men stand in front of a lemon tree looking angry.

props.synopsis: The group posted CCTV footage on social media appearing to show a man breaking into an office in Carlton.

title.children: Police investigate burglary at offices of comedy troupe Sooshi Mango

image.altText: Dr Charles Pain, wears a collared shirt and tie, at a press conference in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Mackay's chief medical officer, Charles Pain, returns to work after an external investigation cleared him of allegations of poor clinical governance.

title.children: Suspension lifted for chief medical officer after 14-month wait

image.altText: Fire engulfs Wynnum home

props.synopsis: Family escapes house fire 'by the skin of their teeth' thanks to their dog who raised the alarm.

title.children: Family escapes fire 'by the skin of their teeth' thanks to pet dog
